2050   /**
2051    * Unassigns the specified region.
2052    * <p>
2053    * Updates the RegionState and sends the CLOSE RPC unless region is being
2054    * split by regionserver; then the unassign fails (silently) because we
2055    * presume the region being unassigned no longer exists (its been split out
2056    * of existence). TODO: What to do if split fails and is rolled back and
2057    * parent is revivified?
2058    * <p>
2059    * If a RegionPlan is already set, it will remain.
2060    *
2061    * @param region server to be unassigned
2062    * @param force if region should be closed even if already closing
2063    */
2064   public void unassign(HRegionInfo region, boolean force) {
2065     // TODO: Method needs refactoring.  Ugly buried returns throughout.  Beware!
2066     LOG.debug("Starting unassignment of region " +
2067       region.getRegionNameAsString() + " (offlining)");
2068 
2069     synchronized (this.regions) {
2070       // Check if this region is currently assigned
2071       if (!regions.containsKey(region)) {
2072         LOG.debug("Attempted to unassign region " +
2073           region.getRegionNameAsString() + " but it is not " +
2074           "currently assigned anywhere");
2075         return;
2076       }
2077     }
2078     String encodedName = region.getEncodedName();
2079     // Grab the state of this region and synchronize on it
2080     RegionState state;
2081     int versionOfClosingNode = -1;
2082     synchronized (regionsInTransition) {
2083       state = regionsInTransition.get(encodedName);
2084       if (state == null) {
2085          // Create the znode in CLOSING state
2086         try {
2087           versionOfClosingNode = ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(
2088             master.getZooKeeper(), region, master.getServerName());
2089           if (versionOfClosingNode == -1) {
2090             LOG.debug("Attempting to unassign region " +
2091                 region.getRegionNameAsString() + " but ZK closing node "
2092                 + "can't be created.");
2093             return;
2094           }
2095         } catch (KeeperException e) {
2096           if (e instanceof NodeExistsException) {
2097             // Handle race between master initiated close and regionserver
2098             // orchestrated splitting. See if existing node is in a
2099             // SPLITTING or SPLIT state.  If so, the regionserver started
2100             // an op on node before we could get our CLOSING in.  Deal.
2101             NodeExistsException nee = (NodeExistsException)e;
2102             String path = nee.getPath();
2103             try {
2104               if (isSplitOrSplitting(path)) {
2105                 LOG.debug(path + " is SPLIT or SPLITTING; " +
2106                   "skipping unassign because region no longer exists -- its split");
2107                 return;
2108               }
2109             } catch (KeeperException.NoNodeException ke) {
2110               LOG.warn("Failed getData on SPLITTING/SPLIT at " + path +
2111                 "; presuming split and that the region to unassign, " +
2112                 encodedName + ", no longer exists -- confirm", ke);
2113               return;
2114             } catch (KeeperException ke) {
2115               LOG.error("Unexpected zk state", ke);
2116               ke = e;
2117             }
2118           }
2119           // If we get here, don't understand whats going on -- abort.
2120           master.abort("Unexpected ZK exception creating node CLOSING", e);
2121           return;
2122         }
2123         state = new RegionState(region, RegionState.State.PENDING_CLOSE);
2124         regionsInTransition.put(encodedName, state);
2125       } else if (force && (state.isPendingClose() || state.isClosing())) {
2126         LOG.debug("Attempting to unassign region " + region.getRegionNameAsString() + 
2127           " which is already " + state.getState()  + 
2128           " but forcing to send a CLOSE RPC again ");
2129         state.update(state.getState());
2130       } else {
2131         LOG.debug("Attempting to unassign region " +
2132           region.getRegionNameAsString() + " but it is " +
2133           "already in transition (" + state.getState() + ", force=" + force + ")");
2134         return;
2135       }
2136     } 
2137     // Send CLOSE RPC
2138     ServerName server = null;
2139     synchronized (this.regions) {
2140       server = regions.get(region);
2141     }
2142     // ClosedRegionhandler can remove the server from this.regions
2143     if (server == null) {
2144       // Possibility of disable flow removing from RIT.
2145       synchronized (regionsInTransition) {
2146         state = regionsInTransition.get(encodedName);
2147         if (state != null) {
2148           // remove only if the state is PENDING_CLOSE or CLOSING
2149           State presentState = state.getState();
2150           if (presentState == State.PENDING_CLOSE
2151               || presentState == State.CLOSING) {
2152             this.regionsInTransition.remove(encodedName);
2153           }
2154         }
2155       }
2156       // delete the node. if no node exists need not bother.
2157       deleteClosingOrClosedNode(region);
2158       return;
2159     }
2160     try {
2161       // TODO: We should consider making this look more like it does for the
2162       // region open where we catch all throwables and never abort
2163       if (serverManager.sendRegionClose(server, state.getRegion(),
2164         versionOfClosingNode)) {
2165         LOG.debug("Sent CLOSE to " + server + " for region " +
2166           region.getRegionNameAsString());
2167         return;
2168       }
2169       // This never happens. Currently regionserver close always return true.
2170       LOG.warn("Server " + server + " region CLOSE RPC returned false for " +
2171         region.getRegionNameAsString());
2172     } catch (NotServingRegionException nsre) {
2173       LOG.info("Server " + server + " returned " + nsre + " for " +
2174         region.getRegionNameAsString());
2175       // Presume that master has stale data.  Presume remote side just split.
2176       // Presume that the split message when it comes in will fix up the master's
2177       // in memory cluster state.
2178     } catch (Throwable t) {
2179       if (t instanceof RemoteException) {
2180         t = ((RemoteException)t).unwrapRemoteException();
2181         if (t instanceof NotServingRegionException) {
2182           if (checkIfRegionBelongsToDisabling(region)
2183               || checkIfRegionBelongsToDisabled(region)) {
2184             // Remove from the regionsinTransition map
2185             LOG.info("While trying to recover the table "
2186                 + region.getTableNameAsString()
2187                 + " to DISABLED state the region " + region
2188                 + " was offlined but the table was in DISABLING state");
2189             synchronized (this.regionsInTransition) {
2190               this.regionsInTransition.remove(region.getEncodedName());
2191             }
2192             // Remove from the regionsMap
2193             synchronized (this.regions) {
2194               this.regions.remove(region);
2195             }
2196             deleteClosingOrClosedNode(region);
2197           }
2198         }
2199         // RS is already processing this region, only need to update the timestamp
2200         if (t instanceof RegionAlreadyInTransitionException) {
2201           LOG.debug("update " + state + " the timestamp.");
2202           state.update(state.getState());
2203         }
2204       }
2205       LOG.info("Server " + server + " returned " + t + " for " +
2206         region.getEncodedName());
2207       // Presume retry or server will expire.
2208     }
2209   }

2211   /**
2212    * 
2213    * @param region regioninfo of znode to be deleted.
2214    */
2215   public void deleteClosingOrClosedNode(HRegionInfo region) {
2216     try {
2217       if (!ZKAssign.deleteNode(master.getZooKeeper(), region.getEncodedName(),
2218           EventHandler.EventType.M_ZK_REGION_CLOSING)) {
2219         boolean deleteNode = ZKAssign.deleteNode(master.getZooKeeper(), region
2220             .getEncodedName(), EventHandler.EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_CLOSED);
2221         // TODO : We don't abort if the delete node returns false. Is there any
2222         // such corner case?
2223         if (!deleteNode) {
2224           LOG.error("The deletion of the CLOSED node for the region "
2225               + region.getEncodedName() + " returned " + deleteNode);
2226         }
2227       }
2228     } catch (NoNodeException e) {
2229       LOG.debug("CLOSING/CLOSED node for the region " + region.getEncodedName()
2230           + " already deleted");
2231     } catch (KeeperException ke) {
2232       master.abort(
2233           "Unexpected ZK exception deleting node CLOSING/CLOSED for the region "
2234               + region.getEncodedName(), ke);
2235       return;
2236     }
2237   }

2239   /**
2240    * @param path
2241    * @return True if znode is in SPLIT or SPLITTING state.
2242    * @throws KeeperException Can happen if the znode went away in meantime.
2243    */
2244   private boolean isSplitOrSplitting(final String path) throws KeeperException {
2245     boolean result = false;
2246     // This may fail if the SPLIT or SPLITTING znode gets cleaned up before we
2247     // can get data from it.
2248     RegionTransitionData data = ZKAssign.getData(master.getZooKeeper(), path);
2249     EventType evt = data.getEventType();
2250     switch (evt) {
2251     case RS_ZK_REGION_SPLIT:
2252     case RS_ZK_REGION_SPLITTING:
2253       result = true;
2254       break;
2255     default:
2256       break;
2257     }
2258     return result;
2259   }

2261   /**
2262    * Waits until the specified region has completed assignment.
2263    * <p>
2264    * If the region is already assigned, returns immediately.  Otherwise, method
2265    * blocks until the region is assigned.
2266    * @param regionInfo region to wait on assignment for
2267    * @throws InterruptedException
2268    */
2269   public void waitForAssignment(HRegionInfo regionInfo)
2270   throws InterruptedException {
2271     synchronized(regions) {
2272       while(!regions.containsKey(regionInfo)) {
2273         // We should receive a notification, but it's
2274         //  better to have a timeout to recheck the condition here:
2275         //  it lowers the impact of a race condition if any
2276         regions.wait(100);
2277       }
2278     }
2279   }

2324   /**
2325    * Assigns all user regions, if any.  Used during cluster startup.
2326    * <p>
2327    * This is a synchronous call and will return once every region has been
2328    * assigned.  If anything fails, an exception is thrown
2329    * @throws InterruptedException
2330    * @throws IOException
2331    */
2332   public void assignUserRegions(List<HRegionInfo> regions, List<ServerName> servers)
2333   throws IOException, InterruptedException {

2335       return;

2340                servers.size() + " server(s)");
2341     // Use fixed count thread pool assigning.
2342     BulkAssigner ba = new StartupBulkAssigner(this.master, bulkPlan, this);
2343     ba.bulkAssign();

2355   /**
2356    * Assigns all user regions, if any exist.  Used during cluster startup.
2357    * <p>
2358    * This is a synchronous call and will return once every region has been
2359    * assigned.  If anything fails, an exception is thrown and the cluster
2360    * should be shutdown.
2361    * @throws InterruptedException
2362    * @throws IOException
2363    */
2364   public void assignAllUserRegions() throws IOException, InterruptedException {
2365     // Skip assignment for regions of tables in DISABLING state also because
2366     // during clean cluster startup no RS is alive and regions map also doesn't
2367     // have any information about the regions. See HBASE-6281.
2368     Set<String> disablingDisabledAndEnablingTables = new HashSet<String>(this.disablingTables);
2369     disablingDisabledAndEnablingTables.addAll(this.zkTable.getDisabledTables());
2370     disablingDisabledAndEnablingTables.addAll(this.enablingTables.keySet());
2371     // Scan META for all user regions, skipping any disabled tables
2372     Map<HRegionInfo, ServerName> allRegions = MetaReader.fullScan(catalogTracker,
2373         disablingDisabledAndEnablingTables, true);
2374     if (allRegions == null || allRegions.isEmpty()) return;
2375 
2376     // Get all available servers
2377     List<ServerName> servers = serverManager.getOnlineServersList();
2378 
2379     // Remove the deadNotExpired servers from the server list.
2380     removeDeadNotExpiredServers(servers);
2381 
2382     // If there are no servers we need not proceed with region assignment.
2383     if(servers.isEmpty()) return;
2384 
2385     // Determine what type of assignment to do on startup
2386     boolean retainAssignment = master.getConfiguration().
2387       getBoolean("hbase.master.startup.retainassign", true);
2388 
2389     Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> bulkPlan = null;
2390     if (retainAssignment) {
2391       // Reuse existing assignment info
2392       bulkPlan = balancer.retainAssignment(allRegions, servers);
2393     } else {
2394       // assign regions in round-robin fashion
2395       assignUserRegions(new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>(allRegions.keySet()), servers);
2396       for (HRegionInfo hri : allRegions.keySet()) {
2397         setEnabledTable(hri);
2398       }
2399       return;
2400     }
2401     LOG.info("Bulk assigning " + allRegions.size() + " region(s) across " +
2402       servers.size() + " server(s), retainAssignment=" + retainAssignment);
2403 
2404     // Use fixed count thread pool assigning.
2405     BulkAssigner ba = new StartupBulkAssigner(this.master, bulkPlan, this);
2406     ba.bulkAssign();
2407     for (HRegionInfo hri : allRegions.keySet()) {
2408       setEnabledTable(hri);
2409     }
2410     LOG.info("Bulk assigning done");
2411   }
2412 
2413   /**
2414    * Run bulk assign on startup.  Does one RCP per regionserver passing a
2415    * batch of reginons using {@link SingleServerBulkAssigner}.
2416    * Uses default {@link #getUncaughtExceptionHandler()}
2417    * which will abort the Server if exception.
2418    */
2419   static class StartupBulkAssigner extends BulkAssigner {
2420     final Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> bulkPlan;
2421     final AssignmentManager assignmentManager;
2422 
2423     StartupBulkAssigner(final Server server,
2424         final Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> bulkPlan,
2425         final AssignmentManager am) {
2426       super(server);
2427       this.bulkPlan = bulkPlan;
2428       this.assignmentManager = am;
2429     }
2430 
2431     @Override
2432     public boolean bulkAssign(boolean sync) throws InterruptedException,
2433         IOException {
2434       // Disable timing out regions in transition up in zk while bulk assigning.
2435       this.assignmentManager.timeoutMonitor.bulkAssign(true);
2436       try {
2437         return super.bulkAssign(sync);
2438       } finally {
2439         // Reenable timing out regions in transition up in zi.
2440         this.assignmentManager.timeoutMonitor.bulkAssign(false);
2441       }
2442     }
2443 
2444     @Override
2445     protected String getThreadNamePrefix() {
2446       return this.server.getServerName() + "-StartupBulkAssigner";
2447     }
2448 
2449     @Override
2450     protected void populatePool(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService pool) {
2451       for (Map.Entry<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> e: this.bulkPlan.entrySet()) {
2452         pool.execute(new SingleServerBulkAssigner(e.getKey(), e.getValue(),
2453           this.assignmentManager));
2454       }
2455     }
2456 
2457     protected boolean waitUntilDone(final long timeout)
2458     throws InterruptedException {
2459       Set<HRegionInfo> regionSet = new HashSet<HRegionInfo>();
2460       for (List<HRegionInfo> regionList : bulkPlan.values()) {
2461         regionSet.addAll(regionList);
2462       }
2463       return this.assignmentManager.waitUntilNoRegionsInTransition(timeout, regionSet);
2464     }
2465 
2466     @Override
2467     protected long getTimeoutOnRIT() {
2468       // Guess timeout.  Multiply the number of regions on a random server
2469       // by how long we thing one region takes opening.
2470       long perRegionOpenTimeGuesstimate =
2471         this.server.getConfiguration().getLong("hbase.bulk.assignment.perregion.open.time", 1000);
2472       int regionsPerServer =
2473         this.bulkPlan.entrySet().iterator().next().getValue().size();
2474       long timeout = perRegionOpenTimeGuesstimate * regionsPerServer;
2475       LOG.debug("Timeout-on-RIT=" + timeout);
2476       return timeout;
2477     }
2478   }
2479 
2480   /**
2481    * Manage bulk assigning to a server.
2482    */
2483   static class SingleServerBulkAssigner implements Runnable {
2484     private final ServerName regionserver;
2485     private final List<HRegionInfo> regions;
2486     private final AssignmentManager assignmentManager;
2487 
2488     SingleServerBulkAssigner(final ServerName regionserver,
2489         final List<HRegionInfo> regions, final AssignmentManager am) {
2490       for (Iterator<HRegionInfo> it = regions.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ) {
2491         if (isAssigningSplitParentRegion(it.next())) {
2492           it.remove();
2493         }
2494       }
2495       this.regionserver = regionserver;
2496       this.regions = regions;
2497       this.assignmentManager = am;
2498     }
2499     @Override
2500     public void run() {
2501       this.assignmentManager.assign(this.regionserver, this.regions);
2502     }
2503   }

2505   /**
2506    * Wait until no regions in transition.
2507    * @param timeout How long to wait.
2508    * @return True if nothing in regions in transition.
2509    * @throws InterruptedException
2510    */
2511   boolean waitUntilNoRegionsInTransition(final long timeout)
2512   throws InterruptedException {
2513     // Blocks until there are no regions in transition. It is possible that
2514     // there
2515     // are regions in transition immediately after this returns but guarantees
2516     // that if it returns without an exception that there was a period of time
2517     // with no regions in transition from the point-of-view of the in-memory
2518     // state of the Master.
2519     long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
2520     long remaining = timeout;
2521     synchronized (regionsInTransition) {
2522       while (regionsInTransition.size() > 0 && !this.master.isStopped()
2523           && remaining > 0) {
2524         regionsInTransition.wait(remaining);
2525         remaining = timeout - (System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime);
2526       }
2527     }
2528     return regionsInTransition.isEmpty();
2529   }
2530 
2531   /**
2532    * Wait until no regions from set regions are in transition.
2533    * @param timeout How long to wait.
2534    * @param regions set of regions to wait for
2535    * @return True if nothing in regions in transition.
2536    * @throws InterruptedException
2537    */
2538   boolean waitUntilNoRegionsInTransition(final long timeout, Set<HRegionInfo> regions)
2539   throws InterruptedException {
2540     // Blocks until there are no regions in transition.
2541     long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
2542     long remaining = timeout;
2543     boolean stillInTransition = true;
2544     synchronized (regionsInTransition) {
2545       while (regionsInTransition.size() > 0 && !this.master.isStopped() &&
2546           remaining > 0 && stillInTransition) {
2547         int count = 0;
2548         for (RegionState rs : regionsInTransition.values()) {
2549           if (regions.contains(rs.getRegion())) {
2550             count++;
2551             break;
2552           }
2553         }
2554         if (count == 0) {
2555           stillInTransition = false;
2556           break;
2557         }
2558         regionsInTransition.wait(remaining);
2559         remaining = timeout - (System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime);
2560       }
2561     }
2562     return stillInTransition;
2563   }
2564 
2565   /**
2566    * Rebuild the list of user regions and assignment information.
2567    * <p>
2568    * Returns a map of servers that are not found to be online and the regions
2569    * they were hosting.
2570    * @return map of servers not online to their assigned regions, as stored
2571    *         in META
2572    * @throws IOException
2573    */
2574   Map<ServerName, List<Pair<HRegionInfo, Result>>> rebuildUserRegions() throws IOException,
2575       KeeperException {
2576     // Region assignment from META
2577     List<Result> results = MetaReader.fullScan(this.catalogTracker);
2578     // Get any new but slow to checkin region server that joined the cluster
2579     Set<ServerName> onlineServers = serverManager.getOnlineServers().keySet();    
2580     // Map of offline servers and their regions to be returned
2581     Map<ServerName, List<Pair<HRegionInfo,Result>>> offlineServers =
2582       new TreeMap<ServerName, List<Pair<HRegionInfo, Result>>>();
2583     // Iterate regions in META
2584     for (Result result : results) {
2585       boolean disabled = false;
2586       boolean disablingOrEnabling = false;
2587       Pair<HRegionInfo, ServerName> region = MetaReader.parseCatalogResult(result);
2588       if (region == null) continue;
2589       HRegionInfo regionInfo = region.getFirst();
2590       ServerName regionLocation = region.getSecond();
2591       if (regionInfo == null) continue;
2592       String tableName = regionInfo.getTableNameAsString();
2593       if (regionLocation == null) {
2594         // regionLocation could be null if createTable didn't finish properly.
2595         // When createTable is in progress, HMaster restarts.
2596         // Some regions have been added to .META., but have not been assigned.
2597         // When this happens, the region's table must be in ENABLING state.
2598         // It can't be in ENABLED state as that is set when all regions are
2599         // assigned.
2600         // It can't be in DISABLING state, because DISABLING state transitions
2601         // from ENABLED state when application calls disableTable.
2602         // It can't be in DISABLED state, because DISABLED states transitions
2603         // from DISABLING state.
2604         boolean enabling = checkIfRegionsBelongsToEnabling(regionInfo);
2605         addTheTablesInPartialState(regionInfo);
2606         if (enabling) {
2607           addToEnablingTableRegions(regionInfo);
2608         } else {
2609           LOG.warn("Region " + regionInfo.getEncodedName() + " has null regionLocation."
2610               + " But its table " + tableName + " isn't in ENABLING state.");
2611         }
2612       } else if (!onlineServers.contains(regionLocation)) {
2613         // Region is located on a server that isn't online
2614         List<Pair<HRegionInfo, Result>> offlineRegions =
2615           offlineServers.get(regionLocation);
2616         if (offlineRegions == null) {
2617           offlineRegions = new ArrayList<Pair<HRegionInfo,Result>>(1);
2618           offlineServers.put(regionLocation, offlineRegions);
2619         }
2620         offlineRegions.add(new Pair<HRegionInfo,Result>(regionInfo, result));
2621         disabled = checkIfRegionBelongsToDisabled(regionInfo);
2622         disablingOrEnabling = addTheTablesInPartialState(regionInfo);
2623         // need to enable the table if not disabled or disabling or enabling
2624         // this will be used in rolling restarts
2625         enableTableIfNotDisabledOrDisablingOrEnabling(disabled,
2626             disablingOrEnabling, tableName);
2627       } else {
2628         // If region is in offline and split state check the ZKNode
2629         if (regionInfo.isOffline() && regionInfo.isSplit()) {
2630           String node = ZKAssign.getNodeName(this.watcher, regionInfo
2631               .getEncodedName());
2632           Stat stat = new Stat();
2633           byte[] data = ZKUtil.getDataNoWatch(this.watcher, node, stat);
2634           // If znode does not exist dont consider this region
2635           if (data == null) {
2636             LOG.debug("Region "+ regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString() + " split is completed. " 
2637                 + "Hence need not add to regions list");
2638             continue;
2639           }
2640         }
2641         // Region is being served and on an active server
2642         // add only if region not in disabled and enabling table
2643         boolean enabling = checkIfRegionsBelongsToEnabling(regionInfo);
2644         disabled = checkIfRegionBelongsToDisabled(regionInfo);
2645         if (!enabling && !disabled) {
2646           synchronized (this.regions) {
2647             regions.put(regionInfo, regionLocation);
2648             addToServers(regionLocation, regionInfo);
2649           }
2650         }
2651         disablingOrEnabling = addTheTablesInPartialState(regionInfo);
2652         if (enabling) {
2653           addToEnablingTableRegions(regionInfo);
2654         }
2655         // need to enable the table if not disabled or disabling or enabling
2656         // this will be used in rolling restarts
2657         enableTableIfNotDisabledOrDisablingOrEnabling(disabled,
2658             disablingOrEnabling, tableName);
2659       }
2660     }
2661     return offlineServers;
2662   }
2663 
2664   private void addToEnablingTableRegions(HRegionInfo regionInfo) {
2665     String tableName = regionInfo.getTableNameAsString();
2666     List<HRegionInfo> hris = this.enablingTables.get(tableName);
2667     if (!hris.contains(regionInfo)) {
2668       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
2669         LOG.debug("Adding region" + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString()
2670             + " to enabling table " + tableName + ".");
2671       }
2672       hris.add(regionInfo);
2673     }
2674   }
2675   
2676   private void enableTableIfNotDisabledOrDisablingOrEnabling(boolean disabled,
2677       boolean disablingOrEnabling, String tableName) {
2678     if (!disabled && !disablingOrEnabling
2679         && !getZKTable().isEnabledTable(tableName)) {
2680       setEnabledTable(tableName);
2681     }
2682   }
2683 
2684   private Boolean addTheTablesInPartialState(HRegionInfo regionInfo) {
2685     String tableName = regionInfo.getTableNameAsString();
2686     if (checkIfRegionBelongsToDisabling(regionInfo)) {
2687       this.disablingTables.add(tableName);
2688       return true;
2689     } else if (checkIfRegionsBelongsToEnabling(regionInfo)) {
2690       if (!this.enablingTables.containsKey(tableName)) {
2691         this.enablingTables.put(tableName, new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>());
2692       } 
2693       return true;
2694     } 
2695     return false;
2696   }

2698   /**
2699    * Recover the tables that were not fully moved to DISABLED state. These
2700    * tables are in DISABLING state when the master restarted/switched.
2701    * 
2702    * @param disablingTables
2703    * @return
2704    * @throws KeeperException
2705    * @throws TableNotFoundException
2706    * @throws IOException
2707    */
2708   private boolean recoverTableInDisablingState(Set<String> disablingTables)
2709       throws KeeperException, TableNotFoundException, IOException {
2710     boolean isWatcherCreated = false;
2711     if (disablingTables.size() != 0) {
2712       // Create a watcher on the zookeeper node
2713       ZKUtil.listChildrenAndWatchForNewChildren(watcher,
2714           watcher.assignmentZNode);
2715       isWatcherCreated = true;
2716       for (String tableName : disablingTables) {
2717         // Recover by calling DisableTableHandler
2718         LOG.info("The table " + tableName
2719             + " is in DISABLING state.  Hence recovering by moving the table"
2720             + " to DISABLED state.");
2721         new DisableTableHandler(this.master, tableName.getBytes(),
2722             catalogTracker, this, true).process();
2723       }
2724     }
2725     return isWatcherCreated;
2726   }
2727 
2728   /**
2729    * Recover the tables that are not fully moved to ENABLED state. These tables
2730    * are in ENABLING state when the master restarted/switched
2731    * 
2732    * @param enablingTables
2733    * @param isWatcherCreated
2734    * @throws KeeperException
2735    * @throws TableNotFoundException
2736    * @throws IOException
2737    */
2738   private void recoverTableInEnablingState(Set<String> enablingTables,
2739       boolean isWatcherCreated) throws KeeperException, TableNotFoundException,
2740       IOException {
2741     if (enablingTables.size() != 0) {
2742       if (false == isWatcherCreated) {
2743         ZKUtil.listChildrenAndWatchForNewChildren(watcher,
2744             watcher.assignmentZNode);
2745       }
2746       for (String tableName : enablingTables) {
2747         // Recover by calling EnableTableHandler
2748         LOG.info("The table " + tableName
2749             + " is in ENABLING state.  Hence recovering by moving the table"
2750             + " to ENABLED state.");
2751         // enableTable in sync way during master startup,
2752         // no need to invoke coprocessor
2753         new EnableTableHandler(this.master, tableName.getBytes(),
2754             catalogTracker, this, true).process();
2755       }
2756     }
2757   }

2762   }

2767   }

2774   /**
2775    * Processes list of dead servers from result of META scan and regions in RIT
2776    * <p>
2777    * This is used for failover to recover the lost regions that belonged to
2778    * RegionServers which failed while there was no active master or regions 
2779    * that were in RIT.
2780    * <p>
2781    * 
2782    * @param deadServers
2783    *          The list of dead servers which failed while there was no active
2784    *          master. Can be null.
2785    * @param nodes
2786    *          The regions in RIT
2787    * @throws IOException
2788    * @throws KeeperException
2789    */
2790   private void processDeadServersAndRecoverLostRegions(
2791       Map<ServerName, List<Pair<HRegionInfo, Result>>> deadServers,
2792       List<String> nodes) throws IOException, KeeperException {
2793     if (null != deadServers) {
2794       Set<ServerName> actualDeadServers = this.serverManager.getDeadServers();
2795       for (Map.Entry<ServerName, List<Pair<HRegionInfo, Result>>> deadServer : 
2796         deadServers.entrySet()) {
2797         // skip regions of dead servers because SSH will process regions during rs expiration.
2798         // see HBASE-5916
2799         if (actualDeadServers.contains(deadServer.getKey())) {
2800           for (Pair<HRegionInfo, Result> deadRegion : deadServer.getValue()) {
2801             nodes.remove(deadRegion.getFirst().getEncodedName());
2802           }
2803           continue;
2804         }
2805         List<Pair<HRegionInfo, Result>> regions = deadServer.getValue();
2806         for (Pair<HRegionInfo, Result> region : regions) {
2807           HRegionInfo regionInfo = region.getFirst();
2808           Result result = region.getSecond();
2809           // If region was in transition (was in zk) force it offline for
2810           // reassign
2811           try {
2812             RegionTransitionData data = ZKAssign.getData(watcher,
2813                 regionInfo.getEncodedName());
2814 
2815             // If zk node of this region has been updated by a live server,
2816             // we consider that this region is being handled.
2817             // So we should skip it and process it in
2818             // processRegionsInTransition.
2819             if (data != null && data.getOrigin() != null && 
2820                 serverManager.isServerOnline(data.getOrigin())) {
2821               LOG.info("The region " + regionInfo.getEncodedName()
2822                   + "is being handled on " + data.getOrigin());
2823               continue;
2824             }
2825             // Process with existing RS shutdown code
2826             boolean assign = ServerShutdownHandler.processDeadRegion(
2827                 regionInfo, result, this, this.catalogTracker);
2828             if (assign) {
2829               ZKAssign.createOrForceNodeOffline(watcher, regionInfo,
2830                   master.getServerName());
2831               if (!nodes.contains(regionInfo.getEncodedName())) {
2832                 nodes.add(regionInfo.getEncodedName());
2833               }
2834             }
2835           } catch (KeeperException.NoNodeException nne) {
2836             // This is fine
2837           }
2838         }
2839       }
2840     }
2841 
2842     if (!nodes.isEmpty()) {
2843       for (String encodedRegionName : nodes) {
2844         processRegionInTransition(encodedRegionName, null, deadServers);
2845       }
2846     }
2847   }

2849   /*
2850    * Presumes caller has taken care of necessary locking modifying servers Map.
2851    * @param hsi
2852    * @param hri
2853    */
2854   private void addToServers(final ServerName sn, final HRegionInfo hri) {
2855     Set<HRegionInfo> hris = servers.get(sn);
2856     if (hris == null) {
2857       hris = new ConcurrentSkipListSet<HRegionInfo>();
2858       servers.put(sn, hris);
2859     }
2860     if (!hris.contains(hri)) hris.add(hri);
2861   }

2921   /**
2922    * Wait on region to clear regions-in-transition.
2923    * @param hri Region to wait on.
2924    * @throws IOException
2925    */
2926   public void waitOnRegionToClearRegionsInTransition(final HRegionInfo hri)
2927   throws IOException {
2928     if (isRegionInTransition(hri) == null) return;
2929     RegionState rs = null;
2930     // There is already a timeout monitor on regions in transition so I
2931     // should not have to have one here too?
2932     while(!this.master.isStopped() && (rs = isRegionInTransition(hri)) != null) {
2933       Threads.sleep(1000);
2934       LOG.info("Waiting on " + rs + " to clear regions-in-transition");
2935     }
2936     if (this.master.isStopped()) {
2937       LOG.info("Giving up wait on regions in " +
2938         "transition because stoppable.isStopped is set");
2939     }
2940   }

2943   /**
2944    * Gets the online regions of the specified table.
2945    * This method looks at the in-memory state.  It does not go to <code>.META.</code>.
2946    * Only returns <em>online</em> regions.  If a region on this table has been
2947    * closed during a disable, etc., it will be included in the returned list.
2948    * So, the returned list may not necessarily be ALL regions in this table, its
2949    * all the ONLINE regions in the table.
2950    * @param tableName
2951    * @return Online regions from <code>tableName</code>
2952    */
2953   public List<HRegionInfo> getRegionsOfTable(byte[] tableName) {
2954     List<HRegionInfo> tableRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
2955     // boundary needs to have table's name but regionID 0 so that it is sorted 
2956     // before all table's regions.
2957     HRegionInfo boundary =
2958       new HRegionInfo(tableName, null, null, false, 0L);
2959     synchronized (this.regions) {
2960       for (HRegionInfo regionInfo: this.regions.tailMap(boundary).keySet()) {
2961         if(Bytes.equals(regionInfo.getTableName(), tableName)) {
2962           tableRegions.add(regionInfo);
2963         } else {
2964           break;
2965         }
2966       }
2967     }
2968     return tableRegions;
2969   }

2971   /**
2972    * Update timers for all regions in transition going against the server in the
2973    * serversInUpdatingTimer.
2974    */
2975   public class TimerUpdater extends Chore {
2976 
2977     public TimerUpdater(final int period, final Stoppable stopper) {
2978       super("AssignmentTimerUpdater", period, stopper);
2979     }
2980 
2981     @Override
2982     protected void chore() {
2983       ServerName serverToUpdateTimer = null;
2984       while (!serversInUpdatingTimer.isEmpty() && !stopper.isStopped()) {
2985         if (serverToUpdateTimer == null) {
2986           serverToUpdateTimer = serversInUpdatingTimer.first();
2987         } else {
2988           serverToUpdateTimer = serversInUpdatingTimer
2989               .higher(serverToUpdateTimer);
2990         }
2991         if (serverToUpdateTimer == null) {
2992           break;
2993         }
2994         updateTimers(serverToUpdateTimer);
2995         serversInUpdatingTimer.remove(serverToUpdateTimer);
2996       }
2997     }
2998   }
2999 
3000   /**
3001    * Monitor to check for time outs on region transition operations
3002    */
3003   public class TimeoutMonitor extends Chore {
3004     private final int timeout;
3005     private boolean bulkAssign = false;
3006     private boolean allRegionServersOffline = false;
3007     private ServerManager serverManager;
3008 
3009     /**
3010      * Creates a periodic monitor to check for time outs on region transition
3011      * operations.  This will deal with retries if for some reason something
3012      * doesn't happen within the specified timeout.
3013      * @param period
3014    * @param stopper When {@link Stoppable#isStopped()} is true, this thread will
3015    * cleanup and exit cleanly.
3016      * @param timeout
3017      */
3018     public TimeoutMonitor(final int period, final Stoppable stopper,
3019         ServerManager serverManager,
3020         final int timeout) {
3021       super("AssignmentTimeoutMonitor", period, stopper);
3022       this.timeout = timeout;
3023       this.serverManager = serverManager;
3024     }

3026     /**
3027      * @param bulkAssign If true, we'll suspend checking regions in transition
3028      * up in zookeeper.  If false, will reenable check.
3029      * @return Old setting for bulkAssign.
3030      */
3031     public boolean bulkAssign(final boolean bulkAssign) {
3032       boolean result = this.bulkAssign;
3033       this.bulkAssign = bulkAssign;
3034       return result;
3035     }

3037     private synchronized void setAllRegionServersOffline(
3038       boolean allRegionServersOffline) {
3039       this.allRegionServersOffline = allRegionServersOffline;
3040     }
3041 
3042     @Override
3043     protected void chore() {
3044       // If bulkAssign in progress, suspend checks
3045       if (this.bulkAssign) return;
3046       boolean allRSsOffline = this.serverManager.getOnlineServersList().
3047         isEmpty();
3048 
3049       synchronized (regionsInTransition) {
3050         // Iterate all regions in transition checking for time outs
3051         long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
3052         for (RegionState regionState : regionsInTransition.values()) {
3053           if (regionState.getStamp() + timeout <= now) {
3054            //decide on action upon timeout
3055             actOnTimeOut(regionState);
3056           } else if (this.allRegionServersOffline && !allRSsOffline) {
3057             RegionPlan existingPlan = regionPlans.get(regionState.getRegion().getEncodedName());
3058             if (existingPlan == null
3059                 || !this.serverManager.isServerOnline(existingPlan.getDestination())) {
3060               // if some RSs just came back online, we can start the
3061               // the assignment right away
3062               actOnTimeOut(regionState);
3063             }
3064           }
3065         }
3066       }
3067       setAllRegionServersOffline(allRSsOffline);
3068     }
3069 
3070     private void actOnTimeOut(RegionState regionState) {
3071       HRegionInfo regionInfo = regionState.getRegion();
3072       LOG.info("Regions in transition timed out:  " + regionState);
3073       // Expired! Do a retry.
3074       switch (regionState.getState()) {
3075       case CLOSED:
3076         LOG.info("Region " + regionInfo.getEncodedName()
3077             + " has been CLOSED for too long, waiting on queued "
3078             + "ClosedRegionHandler to run or server shutdown");
3079         // Update our timestamp.
3080         regionState.updateTimestampToNow();
3081         break;
3082       case OFFLINE:
3083         LOG.info("Region has been OFFLINE for too long, " + "reassigning "
3084             + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString() + " to a random server");
3085         invokeAssign(regionInfo);
3086         break;
3087       case PENDING_OPEN:
3088         LOG.info("Region has been PENDING_OPEN for too "
3089             + "long, reassigning region=" + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
3090         invokeAssign(regionInfo);
3091         break;
3092       case OPENING:
3093         processOpeningState(regionInfo);
3094         break;
3095       case OPEN:
3096         LOG.error("Region has been OPEN for too long, " +
3097             "we don't know where region was opened so can't do anything");
3098         synchronized (regionState) {
3099           regionState.updateTimestampToNow();
3100         }
3101         break;
3102 
3103       case PENDING_CLOSE:
3104         LOG.info("Region has been PENDING_CLOSE for too "
3105             + "long, running forced unassign again on region="
3106             + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
3107         invokeUnassign(regionInfo);
3108         break;
3109       case CLOSING:
3110         LOG.info("Region has been CLOSING for too " +
3111           "long, this should eventually complete or the server will " +
3112           "expire, send RPC again");
3113         invokeUnassign(regionInfo);
3114         break;
3115       }
3116     }
3117   }
3118   
3119   private void processOpeningState(HRegionInfo regionInfo) {
3120     LOG.info("Region has been OPENING for too " + "long, reassigning region="
3121         + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
3122     // Should have a ZK node in OPENING state
3123     try {
3124       String node = ZKAssign.getNodeName(watcher, regionInfo.getEncodedName());
3125       Stat stat = new Stat();
3126       RegionTransitionData dataInZNode = ZKAssign.getDataNoWatch(watcher, node,
3127           stat);
3128       if (dataInZNode == null) {
3129         LOG.warn("Data is null, node " + node + " no longer exists");
3130         return;
3131       }
3132       if (dataInZNode.getEventType() == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED) {
3133         LOG.debug("Region has transitioned to OPENED, allowing "
3134             + "watched event handlers to process");
3135         return;
3136       } else if (dataInZNode.getEventType() != EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENING &&
3137           dataInZNode.getEventType() != EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_FAILED_OPEN ) {
3138         LOG.warn("While timing out a region in state OPENING, "
3139             + "found ZK node in unexpected state: "
3140             + dataInZNode.getEventType());
3141         return;
3142       }
3143       invokeAssign(regionInfo);
3144     } catch (KeeperException ke) {
3145       LOG.error("Unexpected ZK exception timing out CLOSING region", ke);
3146       return;
3147     }
3148     return;
3149   }

3153   }

3156     threadPoolExecutorService.submit(new UnAssignCallable(this, regionInfo));
3157   }

3166   /**
3167    * Check if the shutdown server carries the specific region.
3168    * We have a bunch of places that store region location
3169    * Those values aren't consistent. There is a delay of notification.
3170    * The location from zookeeper unassigned node has the most recent data;
3171    * but the node could be deleted after the region is opened by AM.
3172    * The AM's info could be old when OpenedRegionHandler
3173    * processing hasn't finished yet when server shutdown occurs.
3174    * @return whether the serverName currently hosts the region
3175    */
3176   public boolean isCarryingRegion(ServerName serverName, HRegionInfo hri) {
3177     RegionTransitionData data = null;
3178     try {
3179       data = ZKAssign.getData(master.getZooKeeper(), hri.getEncodedName());
3180     } catch (KeeperException e) {
3181       master.abort("Unexpected ZK exception reading unassigned node for region="
3182         + hri.getEncodedName(), e);
3183     }
3184 
3185     ServerName addressFromZK = (data != null && data.getOrigin() != null) ?
3186       data.getOrigin() : null;
3187     if (addressFromZK != null) {
3188       // if we get something from ZK, we will use the data
3189       boolean matchZK = (addressFromZK != null &&
3190         addressFromZK.equals(serverName));
3191       LOG.debug("based on ZK, current region=" + hri.getRegionNameAsString() +
3192           " is on server=" + addressFromZK +
3193           " server being checked=: " + serverName);
3194       return matchZK;
3195     }
3196 
3197     ServerName addressFromAM = getRegionServerOfRegion(hri);
3198     boolean matchAM = (addressFromAM != null &&
3199       addressFromAM.equals(serverName));
3200     LOG.debug("based on AM, current region=" + hri.getRegionNameAsString() +
3201       " is on server=" + (addressFromAM != null ? addressFromAM : "null") +
3202       " server being checked: " + serverName);
3203 
3204     return matchAM;
3205   }

3207   /**
3208    * Start processing of shutdown server.
3209    * @param sn Server that went down.
3210    * @return Pair that has a set of regions in transition TO the dead server and
3211    * a list of regions that were in transition, and also ON this server.
3212    */
3213   public Pair<Set<HRegionInfo>, List<RegionState>> processServerShutdown(final ServerName sn) {
3214     // Clean out any existing assignment plans for this server
3215     synchronized (this.regionPlans) {
3216       for (Iterator <Map.Entry<String, RegionPlan>> i =
3217           this.regionPlans.entrySet().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
3218         Map.Entry<String, RegionPlan> e = i.next();
3219         ServerName otherSn = e.getValue().getDestination();
3220         // The name will be null if the region is planned for a random assign.
3221         if (otherSn != null && otherSn.equals(sn)) {
3222           // Use iterator's remove else we'll get CME
3223           i.remove();
3224         }
3225       }
3226     }
3227     // TODO: Do we want to sync on RIT here?
3228     // Remove this server from map of servers to regions, and remove all regions
3229     // of this server from online map of regions.
3230     Set<HRegionInfo> deadRegions = new TreeSet<HRegionInfo>();
3231     synchronized (this.regions) {
3232       Set<HRegionInfo> assignedRegions = this.servers.remove(sn);
3233       if (assignedRegions != null && !assignedRegions.isEmpty()) {
3234         deadRegions.addAll(assignedRegions);
3235         for (HRegionInfo region : deadRegions) {
3236           this.regions.remove(region);
3237         }
3238       }
3239     }
3240     // See if any of the regions that were online on this server were in RIT
3241     // If they are, normal timeouts will deal with them appropriately so
3242     // let's skip a manual re-assignment.
3243     Set<HRegionInfo> ritsGoingToServer = new ConcurrentSkipListSet<HRegionInfo>();
3244     List<RegionState> ritsOnServer = new ArrayList<RegionState>();
3245     synchronized (regionsInTransition) {
3246       for (RegionState state : this.regionsInTransition.values()) {
3247         // If destination server in RegionState is same as dead server then add to regions to assign
3248         // Skip the region in OFFLINE state because destionation server in RegionState is master
3249         // server name. Skip the region if the destionation server in RegionState is other than dead
3250         // server.
3251         if ((state.getServerName() != null) && state.getServerName().equals(sn)) {
3252           ritsGoingToServer.add(state.getRegion());
3253         }
3254         if (deadRegions.contains(state.getRegion())) {
3255           ritsOnServer.add(state);
3256         }
3257       }
3258     }
3259     return new Pair<Set<HRegionInfo>, List<RegionState>>(ritsGoingToServer, ritsOnServer);
3260   }

3262   /**
3263    * Update inmemory structures.
3264    * @param sn Server that reported the split
3265    * @param parent Parent region that was split
3266    * @param a Daughter region A
3267    * @param b Daughter region B
3268    */
3269   public void handleSplitReport(final ServerName sn, final HRegionInfo parent,
3270       final HRegionInfo a, final HRegionInfo b) {
3271     regionOffline(parent);
3272     regionOnline(a, sn);
3273     regionOnline(b, sn);
3274 
3275     // There's a possibility that the region was splitting while a user asked
3276     // the master to disable, we need to make sure we close those regions in
3277     // that case. This is not racing with the region server itself since RS
3278     // report is done after the split transaction completed.
3279     if (this.zkTable.isDisablingOrDisabledTable(
3280         parent.getTableNameAsString())) {
3281       unassign(a);
3282       unassign(b);
3283     }
3284   }

3286   /**
3287    * This is an EXPENSIVE clone.  Cloning though is the safest thing to do.
3288    * Can't let out original since it can change and at least the loadbalancer
3289    * wants to iterate this exported list.  We need to synchronize on regions
3290    * since all access to this.servers is under a lock on this.regions.
3291    * 
3292    * @return A clone of current assignments by table.
3293    */
3294   Map<String, Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>>> getAssignmentsByTable() {
3295     Map<String, Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>>> result = null;
3296     synchronized (this.regions) {
3297       result = new HashMap<String, Map<ServerName,List<HRegionInfo>>>();
3298       if (!this.master.getConfiguration().
3299           getBoolean("hbase.master.loadbalance.bytable", true)) {
3300         result.put("ensemble", getAssignments());
3301       } else {
3302         for (Map.Entry<ServerName, Set<HRegionInfo>> e: this.servers.entrySet()) {
3303           for (HRegionInfo hri : e.getValue()) {
3304             if (hri.isMetaRegion() || hri.isRootRegion()) continue;
3305             String tablename = hri.getTableNameAsString();
3306             Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> svrToRegions = result.get(tablename);
3307             if (svrToRegions == null) {
3308               svrToRegions = new HashMap<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>>(this.servers.size());
3309               result.put(tablename, svrToRegions);
3310             }
3311             List<HRegionInfo> regions = null;
3312             if (!svrToRegions.containsKey(e.getKey())) {
3313               regions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
3314               svrToRegions.put(e.getKey(), regions);
3315             } else {
3316               regions = svrToRegions.get(e.getKey());
3317             }
3318             regions.add(hri);
3319           }
3320         }
3321       }
3322     }
3323     Map<ServerName, HServerLoad> onlineSvrs = this.serverManager.getOnlineServers();
3324     // Take care of servers w/o assignments.
3325     for (Map<ServerName,List<HRegionInfo>> map : result.values()) {
3326       for (Map.Entry<ServerName, HServerLoad> svrEntry: onlineSvrs.entrySet()) {
3327         if (!map.containsKey(svrEntry.getKey())) {
3328           map.put(svrEntry.getKey(), new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>());
3329         }
3330       }
3331     }
3332     return result;
3333   }

3335   /**
3336    * @return A clone of current assignments. Note, this is assignments only.
3337    * If a new server has come in and it has no regions, it will not be included
3338    * in the returned Map.
3339    */
3340   Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> getAssignments() {
3341     // This is an EXPENSIVE clone.  Cloning though is the safest thing to do.
3342     // Can't let out original since it can change and at least the loadbalancer
3343     // wants to iterate this exported list.  We need to synchronize on regions
3344     // since all access to this.servers is under a lock on this.regions.
3345     Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> result = null;
3346     synchronized (this.regions) {
3347       result = new HashMap<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>>(this.servers.size());
3348       for (Map.Entry<ServerName, Set<HRegionInfo>> e: this.servers.entrySet()) {
3349         result.put(e.getKey(), new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>(e.getValue()));
3350       }
3351     }
3352     return result;
3353   }

3360   Pair<HRegionInfo, ServerName> getAssignment(final byte [] encodedRegionName) {

3405     public enum State {

3407       PENDING_OPEN,   // sent rpc to server to open but has not begun
3408       OPENING,        // server has begun to open but not yet done
